poem:
**On the Brink**

In the Doha room,  
where whispers hang  
like fragile banners,  
peace teeters thin—  
a glass orb spinning.  
Blinken speaks;  
words scatter,  
barefooted hope  
over desert sands.  
In Gaza, a breath  
pauses,  
anticipates  
the echo of promises,  
a delicate hinge  
soon  
to swing.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Gaza ceasefire negotiations ‘right on the brink’ as mediators meet in Qatar Negotiators met in Doha on Tuesday in an effort to hammer out the final details of a ceasefire in Gaza, as the warring sides were reported to be closing in on a deal and the US secretary of state, Antony Blinken, said the negotiations were “right on the brink”. Israeli media and reports from the Qatari capital said the agreement would involve an". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
